channel.title: Posts - Today I Learnt...
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Today I Learnt...

item.title: How to use `ripgrep` in `while read` loops
item.description: Beware of using rg in a while read block when there’s no path argument.

item.title: How to create a word cloud from text piped via STDIN
item.description: There’s a word_cloud generator package available from PyPI that can take its source text from STDIN:

item.title: About the `typos` source code spell checker
item.description: typos is a source code spell checker written Rust that’s useful for finding typos in code comments and variable names.

item.title: How to perform a non-interactive, interactive Git rebase
item.description: If you create a load of fix-up commits using:

item.title: How to write Vimscript functions that operate on a visually selected area
item.description: I was trying to write a Vim function that would act on a visual selection but found it surprisingly difficult.

item.title: Not to union Python list types
item.description: Consider this contrived function which either returns a list of tuples or a list of dicts depending on an argument value:

item.title: How to show the history of a file with `git log --patch`
item.description: Am slightly embarrassed to admit it but I’ve only just discovered the --patch option to git log which shows diff information for each commit.

item.title: A better technique for roasting chicken
item.description: There’s a great article on cooking chicken by ThermoWorks, from which I learnt a few things.

item.title: How to automatically disable Github Copilot in Vim when editing large files
item.description: Since installing vim-copilot, editing large files had become noticeably slow.

item.title: How to format JSON into a table with `jq` and `column`
item.description: You can create tabular data from JSON using jq to generate tab-separated output and column to format.

item.title: How to make Homebrew-installed Bash your default shell
item.description: I realised today that despite having installed a modern version of Bash (via brew install bash), I was still running Bash v3.

item.title: That `hub` clashes with `vim-polyglot`
item.description: I use Github’s hub library to create pull requests with a command similar to:

item.title: Django's JSON encoder rounds `datetime`s down to the nearest millisecond
item.description: Django provides a custom DjangoJSONEncoder class that can encode datetime.

item.title: How to handle convenience imports with Mypy
item.description: Python convenience imports are where objects are imported into a package’s __init__.

item.title: You can use JQ to build JSON payloads
item.description: It’s possible to use JQ to build JSON payloads as well as filter them.

item.title: How Django's `override_settings` decorator causes flakey tests
item.description: This form can cause flakey tests: from django import forms from django.

item.title: How the `new` argument to `mock.patch` is shared between parameterized tests
item.description: Consider this contrived test: from unittest import mock import pytest def get_config(): """Return a config object with a 'salutation' attribute.

item.title: That Postgres sequences aren't restored after a transaction rollback
item.description: Verify by creating a table and inserting a single row

item.title: Mypy skips empty functions
item.description: Mypy doesn’t check types of empty functions, such as those whose implementation is pass, .

item.title: How to use STDIN to populate Vim's quickfix list
item.description: Vim can be opened in quickfix mode by specifying an error file with the -q option:

item.title: You can search Slack by emoji reactions
item.description: Slack’s lets you search for messages that have had a particular emoji reaction using a has: filter.

item.title: Python tests using `moto` should be explicit about AWS regions
item.description: Consider this test that creates an S3 bucket using moto:

item.title: `which` behaves diffferently in Zsh compared to Bash
item.description: which is a command used to identify the location of executables; however it behaves differently on Zsh compared to Bash.

item.title: AWS target groups fail open when all instances are unhealthy
item.description: In normal conditions, an AWS load balancer will only route requests to healthy instances in its linked target group.

item.title: How `ripgrep` interprets `.gitignore` rules changes when a filepath argument is used
item.description: Consider this dummy static site structure: $ mkdir -p docs/_build/ $ echo "<h1>hello</h1>" > docs/_build/index.

item.title: It's better to explicitly chain Python exceptions
item.description: When converting one type of exception to another in an except block, it’s best to explicitly chain them using the from keyword.

item.title: About indirect parametrization with Pytest
item.description: Pytest’s pytest.mark.parametrize function supports an indirect argument that allows a parametrized test to have its parameter passed to a fixture function, rather than directly into the test function.

item.title: That Ubuntu's `retry` command captures STDOUT
item.description: Debian’s retry command allows you to repeatedly run a command until it succeeds.

item.title: How to create an RST table of contents for the current page only
item.description: To create a table of contents for the current page in reStructuredText, use the following:

item.title: Email Log Search in Google Workspace has some strange behaviour
item.description: Google Workspace admins can use the Email Log Search feature to inspect emails sent and received by Gmail.

item.title: About `pycon` markdown format
item.description: Github-flavoured markdown uses Linguist for syntax highlighting, and Linguist supports “Python console” as a language.

item.title: How to use `xmllint` to extract the failing test filenames from a JUnit-XML file
item.description: Pytest will generate a JUnit-XML result report when run with the --junitxml option.

item.title: How to override Django's settings for every method in a test class
item.description: Django’s override_settings decorator only works on functions and methods in subclasses of unittest.

item.title: How to profile Pytest tests
item.description: If you install the pytest-monitor package, then PyTest invocations will collect test profiling information in a SQLite database (called .

item.title: That Python's `datetime` package doesn't support ordinal suffixes for the day of the month
item.description: Django’s date template filter (and underlying django.utils.dateformat module) support using S as a format character for the English ordinal suffix for the day of the month.

item.title: Some Markdown parsers support definition lists
item.description: Parsers like goldmark (the default parser for Hugo) support definition lists.

item.title: `dprint` can be used to speed up Prettier
item.description: dprint is a formatting platform written in Rust. It supports a Prettier plugin that can give a big performance increase via its incremental formatting functionality.

item.title: How to use look-behind regex assertions with `ripgrep`
item.description: By default ripgrep uses Rust’s regex crate for parsing regular expressions which does not support look-ahead or look-behind assertions.

item.title: How to join an array in Bash
item.description: Say you want to build an array of values then print them out as a tab-separated line:

item.title: Docker for Mac stores all containers and images in a single disk image
item.description: All images and containers are stored in: ~/Library/Containers/com.docker.docker/Data/vms/0/data/Docker.raw as opposed to Linux which uses the /var/lib/docker directory.

item.title: How to inspect and clear Python's `functools.lru_cache`
item.description: Python’s functools.lru_cache binds two additional functions to decorated functions:

item.title: How to get Vale to work with Vim's Ale plugin
item.description: Vale is an extensible syntax aware linter. It can integrate with Vim via Ale although there’s a gotcha to be aware of.

item.title: How to use `markdownlint` output in Vim's quickfix list
item.description: The output from markdownlint-cli has this form: path/to/file.md:13:81 MD013/line-length Line length [Expected: 80; Actual: 102] which doesn’t load correctly into Vim’s quickfix list (via :cfile or :cexpr).

item.title: About Factory Boy's `SelfAttribute` class
item.description: Factory Boy has a useful SelfAttribute class that lets a field reference another field of the object being constructed.

item.title: You can search for Loggly mapping conflicts
item.description: Loggly stores your JSON event data in a single ElasticSearch schema.

item.title: About Github's `involves:$username` search filter
item.description: There’s a plethora of filters that can be used with Github’s search functionality.

item.title: You can't use Django's generic foreign key field with objects stored in a separate database
item.description: Django supports using separate databases for specified models or apps.

item.title: Google Groups can be nested
item.description: You can do this from the “Add members” section of the Group detail page.

item.title: About Django's `setup` method for generic view classes
item.description: Django 2.2 (released in April 2019) introduced a setup method to the django.

item.title: How to list the mounts of a running Docker container
item.description: Use docker inspect like so: docker inspect -f "{{ .

item.title: About Bash's `$SECONDS` shell variable
item.description: Bash provides a $SECONDS environment variable which, if used in a script, returns the number of seconds since the script was started.

item.title: That Vim can transform replacement values when substituting
item.description: Vim supports a range of special patterns that can transform the replacement value when performing a search and replace.

item.title: How to continue a Git rebase and skip editing the commit message
item.description: During an interactive rebase, when you’ve fixed the conflicts or finished editing the commit you can run:

item.title: That AWS Aurora clusters have two types of storage
item.description: Aurora PostgreSQL clusters have: Auto-scaling storage for persistent data (the “cluster volume”).

item.title: How to use `aws-mfa-v2` to avoid entering so many MFA tokens
item.description: Prior to being told about aws-mfa-v2 my ~/.aws/config file looked like this:

item.title: About a gotcha with `psycopg2`'s autocommit handling
item.description: Some commands in Postgres can’t be run inside a transaction (e.

item.title: How to find the files from a commit that deleted a given pattern
item.description: The --name-only option for git log restricts the output to the changed file paths but not their full diffs.

item.title: Python's `envparse` library has counter-intuitive boolean casting
item.description: If you use env.bool from the envparse library to convert an environment variable into a boolean Python variable then only an allow-list of strings are considered truthy.

item.title: About Git's `diff.relative` config option
item.description: Setting this option to true in ~/.gitconfig ensures diff commands show paths relative to the current directory:

item.title: How to effectively scan files using an iPhone
item.description: In iOS 13 the Files app has a useful utility for scanning files accessed via the ellipsis menu in the top-right of the screen.

item.title: How to delete all buffers in Vim
item.description: You can use :%bd (or :%bdelete). This is a special form of the :N,Mbdelete ranged buffer delete command where % indicates all buffers rather than a numbered range.

item.title: Factory boy can be used to build dicts
item.description: Conventionally subclasses of factory.Factory are used to build objects, often Django models that are persisted to some data store.

item.title: Django settings prefixed with an underscore are private
item.description: As in: you can’t access them from outside the settings module.

item.title: How to reset an SSH session
item.description: Hit enter to start a new line then type ~.

item.title: How to easily copy annotated screenshots to the clipboard on macOS
item.description: I frequently want to take screenshots, annotate them, then paste the marked up image into an application like Slack or Github; I don’t want to save a file to the ~/Desktop.

item.title: The names for macOS keyboard meta-characters
item.description: You can insert a ⌘ character using the Character Viewer pop-up.

item.title: About `git merge-base`
item.description: Git’s merge-base command can be used to find the common ancestor for two commits (or branches/references).

item.title: You can have SSH sessions via AWS Session Manager
item.description: This can be achieved by adding a block like this to your ~/.

item.title: Django doesn't flush caches between tests
item.description: This is slightly counter-intuitive as it’s different to how databases are treated by the test runner.

item.title: How Django's management commands need to be type hinted
item.description: For Django management commands with arguments, you might not expect Mypy (configured with the django-stubs plugin) to complain about this signature:

item.title: File-level flake8 comments ignore all errors
item.description: Until today, I was under the impression that including:

item.title: Git aliases that run an external command are run from the repository root
item.description: Verify this by creating an alias in ~/.gitconfig like so:

item.title: That Pytest's "keyword expression" filtering supports Python conditionals
item.description: When using Pytest’s -k filtering, you can use Python expressions to combine separate search terms.

item.title: That FreezeGun doesn't work with Pytest fixtures (unless you use `pytest-freezegun`)
item.description: Wrapping tests classes with FreezeGun’s @freezegun.freeze_time doesn’t control calls to the system clock from fixtures.

item.title: About Chrome's named windows
item.description: Since Google Chrome v88 (Jan 2021), browser windows can be given a name via the .

item.title: About `mypy`'s unreachable code functionality
item.description: Mypy can be configured to raise an error when it finds unreachable code.

item.title: About `jq`'s `--slurp` option
item.description: Problem: you want to find the unique values of a key in some JSON Lines input using jq.

item.title: About `mypy`'s `reveal_type` and `reveal_locals` functions
item.description: Which can be used for debugging type annotation problems.

item.title: That `mypy` only type-checks functions that have at least one type annotation
item.description: This is noted in the common issues and solutions documentation.

item.title: About `git log -G`
item.description: git log supports two options for searching the contents of each commit’s patch:

item.title: About the `:ALEInfo` command
item.description: The ALE plugin for Vim includes a :ALEInfo command that shows how ALE is configured for the current file and the output of any commands that have run.

item.title: About Ubuntu's `alert` Bash alias
item.description: Ubuntu’s default ~/.bashrc includes an alert alias for triggering a desktop notification when a long-running processes has completed:

item.title: About Vim's semi-colon search offset
item.description: A search with / or ? can include an additional offset to position the cursor after jumping to the search match.

item.title: The ISO-3166 codes for the United Kingdon are inaccurate
item.description: The ISO-3166 country codes for the United Kingdom (of Great Britain and Northern Ireland) are GB and GBR.

item.title: That Vim's uppercase marks are global and persistent
item.description: Basic stuff but I didn’t realise that setting an uppercase mark (e.

item.title: Sensitive Terraform Cloud variables are included in Sentinel mocks
item.description: Hashicorp’s Sentinel framework allows you to write tests using a mock Terraform plan file.

item.title: The correct sequence of SQL statements for dropping a role
item.description: Suppose you create a PostgreSQL user with read-only privileges as follows:

item.title: Python's `csv.writer` function defaults to Windows line endings
item.description: I was confused as to why awk wasn’t matching the final element in a CSV stream from csv.

item.title: You can use `shuf` to take random samples of lines
item.description: For example, I wanted to share a random sample of accounts affected by some issue based on a Loggly event export.

item.title: That `vim-polyglot` conflicts with Hub when creating pull requests
item.description: Hub, the Github CLI tool, allows a pull request to be created from the command line.

item.title: About `git-absorb`
item.description: git-absorb is a great tool for crafting atomic commits.

item.title: JSON is valid YAML
item.description: YAML is a superset of JSON which means a YAML parser can parse JSON (but not necessarily the other way around).

item.title: How to convert SSH2 public keys to OpenSSH format
item.description: Turns out cloud-init requires public keys to be in the single-line OpenSSH format but I was passing keys in multi-line SSH2 format.

item.title: How to include the date in `git reflog` output
item.description: By default, the output of git reflog doesn’t include the date when the reference was updated.

item.title: About `xargs -t`
item.description: Which echos the command to be executed to standard error immediately before it is executed.

item.title: What the sections of the Unix manual are
item.description: From man man: MANUAL SECTIONS The standard sections of the manual include: 1 User Commands 2 System Calls 3 C Library Functions 4 Devices and Special Files 5 File Formats and Conventions 6 Games et.

item.title: About delta, a viewer for Git and diff output
item.description: delta provides much improved diff views in the terminal.

item.title: You can have class-scoped autouse pytest fixtures
item.description: If you decorate a class instance method as an autouse=True Pytest fixture, then it will be automatically applied for all test methods on that class.

item.title: That software can be "free as in mattress"
item.description: Extending the notion of “free as in beer” or “free as in speech”, there’s also:

item.title: systemd sends SIGKILL signals after waiting for `TimeoutStopSec` seconds
item.description: From man systemd.kill: Processes will first be terminated via SIGTERM (unless the signal to send is changed via KillSignal=).

item.title: iTerm2's "Cursor boost" feature will cause everything to appear dimmed
item.description: I had inadvertently moved the “Cursor Boost” slider to a high level and the terminal became very dim and hard to read.

item.title: `pdbpp` has a useful 'sticky' mode
item.description: pdbpp provides some additional interactive commands to pdb. One such command is sticky which toggles “sticky mode”:

item.title: systemd timers can be stopped
item.description: Timers are systemd unit files that control services. I didn’t realise until today that, when disabling a timer, it also needs to be stopped too.

item.title: You can use Git log to view the evolution of a function
item.description: Modern versions of git log provide a -L option which lets you trace the evolution of a line range or function:

item.title: To prefer `dateutil` over `pytz`
item.description: When constructing datetime.datetime instances, it’s better to use dateutil to provide the tzinfo argument — avoid using pytz.

item.title: Pytest doesn't play nicely with ipdb
item.description: To ensure breakpoint() triggers ipdb as my default debugger, I used to set:

item.title: Chrome has a flags page for enabling experimental features
item.description: Find it at chrome://flags.

item.title: How to use custom functions with `:cdo`
item.description: Vim’s :cdo command lets you run an Ex command in each entry in the quickfix list.

item.title: The order of permissions matters with `chmod`
item.description: As in these two commands behave differently: chmod -R g+X,g-wx .

item.title: About Github's `@me` search term
item.description: Which lets you filter by the current user. For example, use is:open is:pr author:@me to show pull-requests authored by yourself:

item.title: Recruiters talk about T-shaped leaders
item.description: For example: The T metaphor indicates expertise in a single field as well as the ability to collaborate across disciplines.

item.title: Virgin Media's "Web Safe" product uses DNS
item.description: Virgin Media’s Web Safe product applies its blocking rules using its DNS servers, the same way the OpenDNS’s Family Shield does.

item.title: How to scroll horizontally with a mouse
item.description: If you hold shift while using the mouse wheel then you can scroll horizontally.

item.title: You can take screenshots with Chrome DevTools
item.description: Chrome DevTools can take screenshots via its Command Menu (which can be opened with cmd + shift + p).

item.title: You can arbitrarily chain Python comparison operations
item.description: Which explains why: >>> False == False in [False] True This odd looking expression is equivalent to (False == False) and (False in [False]), hence why it evaluates to True.

item.title: How to pipe an argument list into Vim
item.description: Use something like: echo file1 file2 | xargs -o vim The -o option for xargs re-opens stdin as /dev/tty (rather than the default /dev/null) and is essential otherwise Vim will break your terminal when it exits.

item.title: How to copy the current filepath to the system clipboard in Vim
item.description: Run: :let @* = expand("%") where @* references the system clipboard register.

item.title: How to search for fixed strings with `grep` and `ripgrep`
item.description: To search for a fixed string (i.e. not a regex), use:

item.title: How to easily disable a CircleCI workflow
item.description: Sometimes it’s useful to only run a subset of CircleCI jobs after each commit to a pull request branch.

item.title: BBC Sounds only works on Alexa if the language setting is UK English
item.description: Was puzzled as to why: Alexa, play BBC radio four

item.title: How temporary files are removed on MacOS
item.description: On MacOS, temporary files are stored in either /tmp/ or a per-user temporary folder specified by the $TMPDIR environment variable; this is normally a subfolder of /var/folders/.

item.title: You can define custom file-type filters in `ripgrep`
item.description: ripgrep lets you filter files by their language type — e.

item.title: How to enable Docker BuildKit in MacOS Docker Desktop
item.description: Since Docker 18.09, you can the BuildKit feature to take advantages of improved performance and extra features when building images — see Build images with BuildKit from the Docker docs.

item.title: You can specify the file-type for `bat`
item.description: bat is a useful replacement for cat that supports syntax highlighting.

item.title: About `envsubst`
item.description: Am learning Kubernetes and was looking for ways to dynamically create YAML resource files.

item.title: How to add project-specific Vim settings
item.description: There’s various ways to do this but I quite like using an autocmd based on a buffer’s filepath.

item.title: You can stack `pytest`'s `parametrize` decorators
item.description: As in: import pytest @pytest.mark.parametrize("x", [1,2,3]) @pytest.mark.parametrize("y", [4,5,6]) def test_cartesian_product(x, y): pass which will run the test for all combinations of the two input lists:

item.title: About YAML's node anchors and aliases
item.description: I’ve seen these a few times but only today decided to actually work out how they worked.

item.title: You can label parameterized fixtures with pytest
item.description: For example, running this parameterized test: @pytest.mark.parametrize( "date", ( datetime.

item.title: Universal Ctags can index more things than I realised
item.description: For instance, it can index make, markdown and .

item.title: A better way of configuring `mypy`
item.description: I didn’t realise you can put all your config into setup.

item.title: How to spell-check markdown repos on CircleCI
item.description: The tmaier/markdown-spellcheck Docker image wraps node-markdown-spellcheck and can be used locally and on CircleCI to spell-check markdown files.

item.title: How to set per-project `ripgrep` and `fzf` exclude rules
item.description: In some projects, you want ripgrep to ignore some files that aren’t in .

item.title: Vim-markdown has some useful commands
item.description: I use sheerun/vim-polyglot but disable its markdown support in favour of plasticboy/vim-markdown.

item.title: GSuite's "Groups Admin" role can read any group email
item.description: If members of your Google org want to administer groups, it’s tempting to make them a “Groups Admin”.

item.title: How to run Jekyll in a Docker container
item.description: To run the server, run: docker run --rm \ --volume="${PWD}:/srv/jekyll" \ -p 4000:4000 \ -it jekyll/jekyll:3.

item.title: About how to use `keywordprg` effectively
item.description: Hitting K in Vim opens the program specified by keywordprg, passing the keyword under the cursor as an argument — effectively executing this:

item.title: How to configure `ctags` to parse Terraform files
item.description: If you’re using Universal Ctags (which you should be), you just need to add a ~/.

item.title: You can easily share 1Password items via a link
item.description: People often ask about where certain credentials are in 1Password and I’ve only just discovered each item has a link that can be shared.

item.title: You can convert a Slack group direct message chat into a private channel
item.description: See https://slack.com/intl/en-gb/help/articles/217555437-Move-group-direct-messages-to-a-private-channel

item.title: How to use Bandit with Vim's quickfix list
item.description: One way to populate Vim’s quickfix list is by running :make which runs the program specified by the makeprg setting.

item.title: Exuberant-ctags has been superceded by Universal-ctags
item.description: In the sense that the Exuberant ctags project has stalled, and Universal ctags has been introduced to continue development.

item.title: About `column`
item.description: Which formats input into columns. This is useful for formatting data into a table structure.

item.title: You can hide night-time hours in Google calendar
item.description: In the “Week” view of Google Calendar, it’s annoying that each day is listed from 00:00 onwards.

item.title: You can run `:grep` without using parent shell process
item.description: Using ripgrep as a :grep command can be configured with:

item.title: There's a `QuickFixCmdPost` event in Vim
item.description: Which you can target in an autocmd to open the quickfix window whenever a quickfix command populates the error list (e.

item.title: You can jump to previous quickfix lists in Vim
item.description: Vim remembers the previous ten quickfix lists; you can list them with:

item.title: How to embed markdown content in a Github code block
item.description: Normally, fenced code blocks are delimited with triple backticks ```.

item.title: You can create QR codes for WiFi networks
item.description: Create a QR code for your network at https://qifi.

item.title: `fd` has an option for searching filepaths
item.description: If you pass -p, then the fd will retrieve all filepaths matching $PATTERN:

item.title: `datetime.datetime` is a subclass of `datetime.date`
item.description: See for yourself: >>> import datetime >>> isinstance(datetime.datetime.now(), datetime.

item.title: The keyboard shortcut for grabbing a MFA code in 1PW
item.description: After opening the 1Password mini window (with cmd + option + \), select the item you want and hit shift + ctrl + cmd + c to copy the MFA code to your clipboard.

item.title: How to use AWS profiles that require MFA
item.description: If you have an AWS organisation and several child AWS accounts that you can assume-role into, you can work around MFA restrictions on the trust relationship using a mfa_serial setting in ~/.

item.title: About the difference between minimising and hiding windows in MacOS
item.description: Minimising: ⌘ + m minimises the active application window.

item.title: About `readonly` Bash variables
item.description: Doing this: readonly myvar=1 means that $myvar can’t have its value changed within the global scope.

item.title: About `shellcheck`
item.description: Which is a static analysis tool for shell scripts.

item.title: About `pip-licenses`
item.description: Which is a useful Python library that lists all the licenses of packages installed with pip:

item.title: About Bash's DEBUG signal
item.description: Bash has a DEBUG signal that you can register a handler for using trap.

item.title: How to resolve Git rebase conflicts on renamed files
item.description: If there’s been a large-scale renaming of files in master and you attempt to rebase your pull-request branch, the resulting conflicts can be tricky to resolve.

item.title: There is a "Bongcloud" chess opening
item.description: Which starts 1 f3 and 2 Kf2. Played by Magnus Carlsen recently: https://www.

item.title: How to use `xargs` with `printf`
item.description: This is obvious in retrospect but it hadn’t dawned on me that you can use xargs printf to use STDIN as printf arguments.

item.title: AWS ASGs have an 'instance refresh' feature
item.description: Which lets you replace all the instances in an auto-scaling group, possibly with a new AMI.

item.title: The MacOS keybinds for en- and em-dashes
item.description: Which are: alt + - for an en-dash (–); shift + alt + - for an em-dash (—); You can always get them from the ctrl + cmd + space character picker but good to know quicker alternatives.

item.title: How to read from one buffer to another in Vim
item.description: Refer to the buffer’s number using a hash. For example, run:

item.title: SSH config supports multiple host patterns in one block
item.description: From man ssh_config: Host Restricts the following declarations (up to the next Host or Match keyword) to be only for those hosts that match one of the patterns given after the keyword.

item.title: There's a Chrome extension for switching AWS IAM roles
item.description: It’s the AWS Extend Switch Roles extension. AWS’s Console only keeps your 5 most recent AWS accounts as quick links, which this extension gives doesn’t limit you.

item.title: YAML has several string-parsing gotchas
item.description: For instance, in YAML 1.1: Yes and No parse to true and false x:y is parsed as a base-60 number if y is less than 60 See for yourself with these Python tests:

item.title: Javascript's unary `+` operator casts `null` to zero
item.description: As in: > +null 0 which is different from parseInt or parseFloat which return NaN when given null.

item.title: How to count lines of code in a Git repo for a given commit
item.description: For a given commit $SHA, use: git diff --shortstat `git hash-object -t tree /dev/null`.

item.title: About Vim's `:helpgrep` command
item.description: Which lets you search Vim’s help files for a given pattern.

item.title: Vim recommends using Emacs-style key bindings in command mode
item.description: As in, using these command-mode maps: " start of line :cnoremap <C-A> <Home> " back one character :cnoremap <C-B> <Left> " delete character under cursor :cnoremap <C-D> <Del> " end of line :cnoremap <C-E> <End> " forward one character :cnoremap <C-F> <Right> " recall newer command-line :cnoremap <C-N> <Down> " recall previous (older) command-line :cnoremap <C-P> <Up> " back one word :cnoremap <Esc><C-B> <S-Left> " forward one word :cnoremap <Esc><C-F> <S-Right> See http://vimdoc.

item.title: How to conditionally include items in a Terraform list
item.description: It’s not obvious how to build a Terraform list where an item is only included if some condition is met.

item.title: You can change the font in Slack with `/slackfont $font`
item.description: For example: /slackfont Comic Sans MS or even /slackfont Wingdings.

item.title: You can display the typed text in Alfred in a huge typeface
item.description: By pressing cmd + L after typing the text.

item.title: Python 3.7 supports postponed evaluation of annotations
item.description: For example, instead of: import _csv def generate_report(writer: '_csv.

item.title: Vim doesn't create the persistent undo folder automatically
item.description: I have this in ~/.vimrc: " Keep undo history between sessions if has('persistent_undo') set undofile set undodir=~/.

item.title: How to use type annotations with Python's `csv` module
item.description: Adding a type annotation for a “writer” object created by csv.

item.description: This applies to the Bear workflow written in Go whose default behaviour (in v1.

item.title: About better YAML file folding in Vim
item.description: Using foldmethod=indent is ok but it’s better to use the pedrohdz/vim-yaml-folds plugin.

item.title: OpenDNS provide free porn-blocking DNS servers
item.description: Installation requires switching the DNS servers of your router or device to use the OpenDNS ones.

item.title: You can rate-limit issues using a Sentry DSN
item.description: If you want to manage how your event quota is consumed with Sentry, you can apply rate limits at the DSN level.

item.title: About the stationery pad feature in Finder
item.description: If you use Finder to mark a file as a “stationery pad” then apps will open a copy of the file.

item.title: About text fragments
item.description: Modern versions of Chrome and Edge support Text Fragments, which let you specify a text snippet in the URL fragment that the browser can highlight (or bring to the user’s attention in another way).

item.title: Renaming a Terraform module is dangerous
item.description: As the state file uses the module name in identifiers and so a module rename causes Terraform to think all existing resources need to be destroyed and recreated.

item.title: Where authentication for the `ubuntu` user on a EC2 instance is defined
item.description: The file that controls where the default ubuntu user on an Ubuntu EC2 instance is /etc/sudoers.

item.title: About the phrase "Parking downhill"
item.description: From https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=23118940 Before putting a project or incomplete task away, make notes of what the next thing was that you were going to work on.

item.title: About Alfred's clipboard history feature
item.description: Alfred has a clipboard history feature which lets you easily pluck out previous values from your system clipboard.

item.title: About Quitter
item.description: There’s a MacOS app called Quitter which will automatically quit applications after some period of inactivity.

item.description: It’s what MacOS uses for its shortcuts but can be called from the command-line:

item.title: About Twitter's `min_faves` search filter
item.description: You can do searches like: from:frankieboyle min_faves:10000 to see, for example, the best tweets from a given account.
